definition: to accompany/to keep sb company/to assist/old variant of 賠|赔[pei2]

sentences.english: One of the jurors immediately declares himself in favour of the utmost rigour of the law being applied to the young woman.
sentences.chinese: 有一名陪審員當即宣佈希望能用最嚴厲的法律制裁她。

sentences.english: Some courts use anonymous juries, meaning that jurors are identified only by number.
sentences.chinese: 一些法院採用匿名陪審團，即用數字代號標識陪審員。

sentences.english: In some places, jurors may ask questions during the trial.
sentences.chinese: 在有些地方，陪審員在庭審中可以提出問題。

sentences.english: One of the most troubling of these problems is the impact of race on jury selection.
sentences.chinese: 這些問題中最令人不安的是種族對遴選陪審員的影響。

sentences.english: The people's court shall ensure that people's assessors can participate in trial activities according to law.
sentences.chinese: 人民法院應當依法保障人民陪審員參加審判活動。

sentences.english: For people's assessors , the participation in trial activities in accordance with law shall be guaranteed by law.
sentences.chinese: 人民陪審員依法參加審判活動，受法律保護。

sentences.english: "The citizeness is superb! " croaked the Juryman.
sentences.chinese: “優秀的女公民，”陪審員低沉着嗓子說。

sentences.english: The jury filed out of the courtroom.
sentences.chinese: 陪審員們從法庭裏魚貫而出。

sentences.english: The attorney for the defense challenged the juror.
sentences.chinese: 被告辯護律師不同意這位陪審員。

sentences.english: What makes expert witnesses credible with jurors?
sentences.chinese: 什麼使專家證言讓陪審員感到可靠？

sentences.english: Jurors deliberated for about two hours before recessing for the day.
sentences.chinese: 陪審員審議了大約兩個小時，然後休庭一天。

sentences.english: All that appears to have been what stuck in some jurors' craw.
sentences.chinese: 這一切都令有些陪審員難以接受。

sentences.english: Miss Burgess is led away while the jurors discuss the case.
sentences.chinese: 陪審員討論案件的時候布吉斯被帶走了。

sentences.english: This involves spending a lot of time in the courtroom and some downtime hanging out in the jury room.
sentences.chinese: 這包含要在法庭和休庭期間的陪審員室度過很長時間。

sentences.english: Such jurors functioned as both witnesses and triers of fact.
sentences.chinese: 這種陪審員的功能相當於證人和事實的審判者。

sentences.english: He will sit on the jury at the trial.
sentences.chinese: 他將是審判該案的陪審員。

definition: to counter accusations/to protest/to remonstrate/to retort/to plead/to demur/a plea (of not guilty)/a defense (against an allegation)/to enter a plea to a charge (in a law court)
on trial (for a crime)/to stand trial
